page.title: 07Bishops Woods History
page.content: By M. Dickson This site was once covered by the ancient extensive{Feckenham Forest. It's name until about 1838 was {Lineholt Wood}but this had changed by the begining of the present century to {Bishops Wood}maybe because of episcopal associations. The manner of Hartlebury is included in the Domesday Book among lands belonging to the see of Worcester and for much of the time thereafter the wood was probably part of the manor.Bishops of Worcester held free warren of the manor from 1255 and it is likely that the wood was hunted by them for game. The wood itself is now one corner of the old Wyre Forest, isolated, as most of the land around has been cleared. The woodland nowe has to be 'managed';if it was simply left to run wild it would be completely inaccessible.
